channel.title: Projects on Alfonso Barajas Cervantes
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Alfonso Barajas Cervantes

item.title: Project 5: Raw vegan diet Optimization Cost-Nutrition
item.description: Libraries Numpy Pandas Repository Link This is a question I have asked to myself due to the economical impact in Mexico after the pandemic hit. Given a limited budget, how we can obtain the best nutritional content of what we buy as a produce. I abstract a problem of real impact to a mathematical model that could be resolved using computational resources.

item.title: Project 4: Currency Exchanges (OLAP)
item.description: Libraries Software used SQL PostgreSQL pgmodeler Repository Link About this Project It is required to analyze information corresponding to a chain of exchanges branches in Mexico, that sells and buys dollars. They receive information of the daily sales of dollars, the client’s name and employee’s name that make the deal with the client.

item.title: Project 3: Finite Differences
item.description: Libraries used Numpy Matplotlib Seaborn Repository Link About this Project We utilize the numerical method Finite Differences in which we obtain the solution of a partial derivatives about the heat conduction in the solid of study. To do that, we divide the continuous domain into a discrete domain to understand the conduction of heat among the particles of the body.

item.title: Project 2: Alumni Network (OLTP)
item.description: Libraries Software used SQL PostgreSQL Power Designer Repository Link About this Project A University decided to automate its management of its alumni. The system has to answer the following questions: Given the major, we want to know their affiliation number of the University and their address of every student that studied that major.

item.title: Project 1: Polynomial Approximation and Weather Forecast
item.description: Libraries used Pandas Numpy Repository Link About this project Polynomial Approximation of degree 3 to forecast the temperature given the month and state of Mexico, we decided the best approximation based on the principle of least squares. Project Challenges Deal with large data sets of data and load it. How to make the segmentation periods of time correctly, so we can forecast the weather.
